gruppe.irc

Class IRCConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • gruppe.irc.IRCClient
      • gruppe.irc.IRCConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class IRCConnection
extends IRCClient
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class controls the connection to a IRC server. Use this class to represent the connection, then add the listeners needed to receive those events you feel you should receive from this connection. Use the classes writeln method to send commands back to the server.
    Author:
    : Kolloen. This is a class made and commented by our teacher in IMT3281. Some additional functionality are added by us, including its extension of IRCClient.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IRCConnection

        public IRCConnection(java.lang.String server,
             int port,
             java.lang.String nick,
             java.lang.String altNick,
             java.lang.String username,
             java.lang.String fullname)
        Constructor for setting up a new IRCConnection object. The constructor takes all the details for the new connection but does not actually make the connection active. To activate a new IRCConnection object you need to call the connect method.
        Parameters:
        server - a string with the name of the server to connect to
        port - the port number on which the connection should be made
        nick - the users preferred nickname
        altNick - the users alternative nickname (ignored in this implementation)
        username - the users username
        fullname - the users full name

    • Method Detail

      • addMessageListener

        public void addMessageListener(MessageListener ml)
        Method used to add a message listener. The MessageListener object will be inserted into the list of listeners that will be traversed when trying to find a suitable listener to send a given message to.
        Parameters:
        ml - a MessageListener object to insert into the list of active listeners

      • removeMessageListener

        public void removeMessageListener(MessageListener ml)
        Method used to remove a message listener from the list of active listeners.
        Parameters:
        ml - a reference to the MessageListener object to be removed.

      • connect

        public void connect()
        Method used to initiate the connection process. Calling this method will start up a new thread that will handle this connection and initiate the connection process. The calling method will have to monitor the state of this object to find out if and when the connection process successfully completes.

      • writeln

        public void writeln(java.lang.String message)
        Method used to send a message to the server. All the method does is append a carriage return and newline to the given string and send that to the server.
        Parameters:
        message - a string to be sendt as a command to the server.

      • run

        public void run()
        Method not to be called directly. This method contains the code that actually connects to the server and handles the client server interaction. Contains a loop that continually listens to transmissions from the server.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • close

        public void close()

      • getState

        public int getState()
        Method that returns the state of the connection
        Returns:
        an integer telling the state of this connection object.

      • getNick

        public java.lang.String getNick()
        Returns:
        : The nick set in constructor.

      • getAltNick

        public java.lang.String getAltNick()
        Returns:
        : The alternative nick in set in constructor.

      • getServerName

        public java.lang.String getServerName()
        Returns:
        : The name of server set in constructor.

      • abortLogin

        public void abortLogin()
        This function sets the sate to "ABORTED". Also tells the IRCCLient to clean up frames and such created.
